use_subfolder.title: Save images in subfolder
use_subfolder.description: If checked the images will be saved in a subfolder. You can either set your own folder or choose from the presets

firstLetterLowerCase.title: First letter
firstLetterLowerCase.description: If checked the first letter of the filename will always be lowercase

ignoreMulUperCase.title: Multiple upper Case
ignoreMulUperCase.description: If checked words where the second letter is uppercase won't be put in the normal camelCase. This means all letters being Uppercase will stay that way if the second letter is Uppercase

automaticCamelCase.title: Automatic camelCase
automaticCamelCase.description: The name of the imagefile will automatically be put into to camelCase. The first letter afert a space will be written in uppercas. The first letter of the filename will depend on the setting `First Letter`

description: Just use 'ctrl+v' paste image into markdown
name: markdown-image-paste
readme:
# Markdown-img-paste

## Usage
1. Take a screenshot or copy a image
2. Go to a new (empty) line
2. Write the filename you want the image saved under into that empty line
3. hit `ctrl+v` to paste image into the markdown or rst file
1. The replacement text (in casethe image can't be found) will be the text you wrote, the filename will be the text you wrote without spaces

By default, the image will store in current directory. But you can change this under settings:

## Setting

### Enable plugin only in markdown files

If not, you can paste markdown images in any file.
